Manchester City transfer news: Nicolas Otamendi would find Real Madrid switch ‘difficult to turn down’ 
La Liga giants interested in Argentinian defender as replacement for Pepe By Sam Green Comments MANCHESTER CITY defender Nicolas Otamendi appears to be fluttering his eyelashes at Real Madrid. 
The Argentine has emerged as a target for the 11-times European champions , who are looking to replace Portuguese hothead Pepe. 
And Otamendi’s agent, Martin Sendoa, has told Spanish newspaper AS that the 29-year-old would find a return to La Liga “difficult to turn down”. Getty Images Nicolas Otamendi joined Manchester City from Valencia in 2015 AP:Associated Press After 10 seasons at the Bernabeu, Pepe could be on his way to China 
Otamendi has failed to convince since his £28.5million transfer from Valencia to the Etihad Stadium in 2015. 
And Sendoa also confirmed on Spanish radio that his client is being tracked by Zinedine Zidane’s team, with 33-year-old Pepe’s contract ending this summer.

“Nico has a profile very similar to Pepe, who will leave at the end of the season,” Sendoa said.

Real need a new partner for club talisman Sergio Ramos in the heart of their defence. 
They are also reported to be considering a swoop for Borussia Dortmund centre-back Sokratis Papastathopoulos.
